Detailed Description

VoIP headset manager. Wraps Xbox One Game Chat api.

Attention
Copyright (c) Electronic Arts 2013. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
Version
05/24/2013 (mclouatre) First Version

Function Documentation

int32_t VoipHeadsetControl ( VoipHeadsetRefT *  pHeadset,
int32_t  iControl,
int32_t  iValue,
int32_t  iValue2,
void *  pValue 
)

Control function.

Parameters
*pHeadset- headset module state
iControl- control selector
iValue- control value
iValue2- control value
*pValue- control value
Returns
int32_t - selector specific, or -1 if no such selector
Note
iControl can be one of the following:
        'ambr' - enable or disable auto muting for bad rep users (default is enabled)
        '+pbk' - enable voice playback for a given remote user (pValue is the remote user VoipUserT).
        '-pbk' - disable voice playback for a given remote user (pValue is the remote user VoipUserT).
        'aloc' - set local user as participating / not participating
        'loop' - enable/disable loopback
        'qual' - set encoding quality
        'rloc' - register/unregister local talker
        'spam' - debug verbosity level
Version
05/24/2013 (mclouatre)

References VoipHeadsetRefT::bAutoMuteBadRep, VoipHeadsetRefT::bAutoMuteCheckCompleted, VoipHeadsetRefT::bLoopback, ds_stristr(), VoipHeadsetRefT::EncodingQual, FALSE, NetPrintf, VoipUserT::strUserId, TRUE, and VOIP_MAXLOCALUSERS_EXTENDED.

Referenced by VoipActivateLocalUser(), VoipCommonControl(), and VoipControl().

VoipHeadsetMicDataCbT *  pMicDataCb,
VoipHeadsetStatusCbT *  pStatusCb,
void *  pCbUserData,
int32_t  iData 
)

Create the headset manager.

Parameters
iMaxChannels- max number of remote users
*pMicDataCb- pointer to user callback to trigger when mic data is ready
*pStatusCb- pointer to user callback to trigger when headset status changes
*pCbUserData- pointer to user callback data
iData- platform-specific - unused for xboxone
Returns
VoipHeadsetRefT * - pointer to module state, or NULL if an error occured
Version
05/24/2013 (mclouatre)

int32_t VoipHeadsetStatus ( VoipHeadsetRefT *  pHeadset,
int32_t  iSelect,
int32_t  iValue,
void *  pBuf,
int32_t  iBufSize 
)

Status function.

Parameters
*pHeadset- headset module state
iSelect- control selector
iValue- selector specific
*pBuf- buffer pointer
iBufSize- buffer size
Returns
int32_t - selector specific, or -1 if no such selector
Note
iSelect can be one of the following:
        'ambr' - TRUE if auto mute bad reputation check is enabled
        'amcc' - TRUE if auto mute bad reputation check is completed
        'amuc' - TRUE if the given user should be muted because of bad reputation
        'kine' - TRUE if kinect is in set of active capture source, FALSE otherwise
        'ruid' - return TRUE if the given remote user (pBuf) is registered with voipheadset, FALSE if not.
        'supd' - TRUE if chat session update is in progress
        'sact' - TRUE if the shared device (kinect) is active
        'vlen' - TRUE if voice sub-packet have variable length, FALSE otherwise
Version
05/24/2013 (mclouatre)

References VoipHeadsetRefT::aRemoteSharedUsers, VoipHeadsetRefT::bAutoMuteBadRep, VoipHeadsetRefT::bAutoMuteCheckCompleted, VoipHeadsetRefT::bHeadsetFound, VoipHeadsetRefT::bIsKinectAvailable, VoipHeadsetRefT::bKinectIsCapturing, VoipHeadsetRefT::bSessionStateRefreshInProgress, ds_snzprintf(), FALSE, VoipHeadsetRefT::refChatSession, VoipUserT::strUserId, TRUE, RemoteSharedUserT::user, VOIP_MAX_LOW_LEVEL_CONNS, and VOIP_SameUser.
